action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Upon hitting a creature, make a contested athletics check. If the creature fails, the Great Jagras swallows them, causing them to be {@condition grappled}, and they take a {@damage 1d6} acid damage at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} Great Jagras whips the area in front or behind him in a 15 ft. cone. {@hit 5} to hit to each creature in the radius, dealing ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgenoning damage to each.

legendary.name: Swallow
entries: When the Great Jagras fails a check, they can choose to succeed instead; however, when they do, they must swallow a medium or lower sized creature next to them, swallowing them and causing them to take a -5 penalty to movement speed and -1 penalty to AC until the creature is disgested.

From the Monster's Diary on the Great Jagras: "This fucking freak. Good god. If you think its goons are annoying, you havent seen this guy gobble up your entire picnic. It may be large, but its still mortal. A fire weapon will really knock this thing out of the park. Don't let it near an Aptonoth, youre not going to like what you see."

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., two targets. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

From the Hunter's Diary excerpt on Jagras: "These stupid fucking lizards are a pain in the ass. jagras or, whatever, really. i was never really one to care for small monsters. always hitting me right when im about to do something important. kill as fast as possible"
